p: Monthly varying SSTs from four climate models (Community Climate System Model 4, GFDL-CM3, GFDL-Earth System Model 2G, and Model for Interdisciplinary Research on Climate 5) participating in CMIP5 are used to force the HiRAM model. These models are chosen based on two criteria: ( i) their skill in simulating Juneâ€“September seasonal mean monsoon precipitation over India ( 22) and ( ii) the SST bias over the Arabian Sea, which is found to introduce a dry bias over India ( 36, 37) (models with weaker bias are preferred). Biases in climate model SSTs can lead to errors when atmospheric models are forced with these SSTs ( 38). Hence, we applied an SST bias correction (described below). The HiRAM model is configured with a horizontal resolution of 50 km and 32 vertical hybrid pressure levels.
